item.title: The making of
item.description: This is a post about creating a website using Hugo, GitHub, and blogdown for Rmarkdown. There are a number of approaches to this setup, where it starts and which tools to use specifically. My approach is based on prior experience with static site generators, markdown, GitHub, and RStudio. The GitHub repo for this site contains a more detailed history. Phase One Acceptance I was due for making another work website, and I started with the most obvious option — I made a Wordpress site on my school’s hosting platform.

item.title: Shiny apps with GNIP data
item.description: (in progress) Apps hosted on shinyapps.io can’t be displayed on published Rmarkdown pages. This is an intentional limitation of shinyapps, to prevent overuse by bots that might crawl a public page elsewhere. An app can be embedded in an Rmarkdown document, as a frame linked to the app, or as embedded Shiny code if the Rmarkdown file won’t be used to generate a static page. For use with Hugo, I’d have to host my apps somewhere other than shinyapps.
